paragraphs.title: Step 0: Start Zeppelin, Hadoop and Hive
paragraphs.text:
$HADOOP_HOME/sbin/hadoop-daemon.sh start namenode
$HADOOP_HOME/sbin/hadoop-daemon.sh start datanode

$HADOOP_HOME/sbin/yarn-daemon.sh start resourcemanager
$HADOOP_HOME/sbin/yarn-daemon.sh start nodemanager

$HADOOP_HOME/sbin/mr-jobhistory-daemon.sh start historyserver

msg.data:
starting namenode, logging to /usr/share/hadoop-2.7.3/logs/hadoop-bigdata-namenode-bigdata-VirtualBox.out
starting datanode, logging to /usr/share/hadoop-2.7.3/logs/hadoop-bigdata-datanode-bigdata-VirtualBox.out
starting resourcemanager, logging to /usr/share/hadoop-2.7.3/logs/yarn-bigdata-resourcemanager-bigdata-VirtualBox.out
starting nodemanager, logging to /usr/share/hadoop-2.7.3/logs/yarn-bigdata-nodemanager-bigdata-VirtualBox.out
starting historyserver, logging to /usr/share/hadoop-2.7.3/logs/mapred-bigdata-historyserver-bigdata-VirtualBox.out

paragraphs.title: Step 1: How to create and how to load data into an internal table ?
paragraphs.text:
%hive
create table ORDERS(
    part char(7),
    customer varchar(30),
    amount decimal(8,2),
    oyear decimal(4),
    omonth decimal(2),
    oday decimal(2) 
) 
row format delimited fields terminated by ',' stored as textfile;

msg.data: Query executed successfully. Affected rows : -1

paragraphs.text:
%hive
load data local inpath '/home/bigdata/Desktop/dep/items.txt' into table orders;

msg.data: Query executed successfully. Affected rows : -1

paragraphs.text:
%hive
select * from Orders;

paragraphs.title: Step 2: How to perform a simple aggregation with group by and having clauses ?
Total number of orders per each part
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, count(*)
from orders
group by part;

paragraphs.title: find the total number of ordered parts summarized per each part
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, sum(amount)
from orders
group by part;

paragraphs.title: total num of orders per customer and list customers who submitted more than one order
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select customer, count(*)
from orders
group by customer
having count(*) > 1;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: find in one query the total number of orders per each part, per  each customer and per both part and custome
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, NULL, count(*)
    from orders
    group by part
union
select NULL, customer, count(*)
    from orders
    group by customer
union
select part, customer, count(*)
    from orders
    group by part, customer;

paragraphs.title: Step 3: How to perform aggregations with rollup operator ?
paragraphs.text: %hive

paragraphs.title: find the total number of parts ordered and summarized per part and per customer, then per part and then total number of all parts ordered.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, customer, sum(amount)
    from orders
    group by part, customer
union
select part, null, sum(amount)
    from orders
    group by part
union
select null, null, sum(amount)
    from orders;

paragraphs.title: finds the total  number of parts ordered and summarized per year and month, per year, and the total  number of parts ordered.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select oyear, omonth, sum(amount)
    from orders
    group by oyear, omonth with rollup;

paragraphs.title: Step 4: How to perform aggregation with cube operator ?
paragraphs.text: %hive

paragraphs.title: find an average number of parts ordered and summarized per part, per  customer, per both part and customer and an average number of parts per order.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, customer, avg(amount)
    from orders
    group by part, customer with cube;

paragraphs.title: Step 5: How to perform aggregations with grouping sets operator
paragraphs.text: %hive

paragraphs.title: find the total number of orders per part and per customer and both per year and customer.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, customer, oyear, count(*)
    from orders
    group by part, customer, oyear
    grouping sets ((part), (customer), (oyear,customer));

paragraphs.title: find the total number of parts ordered and summarized per year, month,  day, per year and month , and per year, and the total number of parts ordered.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select oyear, omonth, oday, sum(amount)
    from orders
    group by oyear, omonth, oday
    grouping sets ((oyear, omonth, oday), (oyear, omonth), (oyear), ());

paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, customer, amount, 
 MAX(amount) over (partition by part),
 SUM(amount) over (partition by part)
from orders;

paragraphs.title: find how the ordered amounts of ordered parts changed year by year.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, amount, oyear,
 SUM(amount) over (partition by part order by oyear)
from orders;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, amount, 
 AVG(amount) over (partition by part 
 order by amount, oyear, omonth, oday)
from orders;

paragraphs.text: %hive

paragraphs.title: query that for each part and amount finds an average of amount ordered by year,  month and day.

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

    (partition by part order by oyear, omonth, oday rows 1 preceding)
from orders;

paragraphs.title: Step 9: How to use window clause
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, SUM(amount) over w 
from orders
window w as (partition by part);

paragraphs.title: Step 10: How to use LEAD and LAG functions
paragraphs.text: %hive

paragraphs.title: find the current and the next amount for each  part ordered by year, month, day.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, amount, LEAD(amount) over (partition by part 
 order by oyear, omonth,oday)
from orders;

paragraphs.title: Empty places (NULLs) can be eliminated with a parameter 0 in LAG function.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, amount, amount+lag(amount,1,0) over(partition by part 
 order by oyear, omonth, oday)
from orders;

paragraphs.title: Step 11: How to use analytics functions
paragraphs.text: %hive

paragraphs.title: A function RANK() assigns a rank to row such that the rows with the same value of amount are ranked with the same number and rank is increased by the total number of rows with the same value.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, amount, 
 RANK() over (partition by part order by amount)
from orders;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

bolt   	300.00	5
nut    	23.00	1
screw  	20.00	1
screw  	55.00	2
washer 	45.00	1
washer 	100.00	2

paragraphs.title: A function DENSE_RANK() assigns a rank to row such that the rows with the same value  of amount are ranked with the same number and rank is increased by 1 for each group of  rows with the same value of amount.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, amount, 
 DENSE_RANK() over (partition by part 
 order by amount)
from orders;

paragraphs.title: A function CUME_DIST() computes the relative position of a specified value in a group of  values. For a given row r, the CUME_DIST()the number of rows with values lower than or  equal to the value of r, divided by the number of rows being evaluated, i.e. entire window.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, amount, 
 CUME_DIST() over (partition by part order by amount)
from orders;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: A function PERCENT_RANK() is similar to a function CUME_DIST(). For a row r, PERCENT_RANK() calculates the rank of r minus 1, divided by the number of rows being evaluated -1 , i.e. entire window-1
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, amount, 
 PERCENT_RANK() over (partition by part 
 order by amount)
from orders;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: A function NTILE(k) divides a window into a number of buckets indicated by k and  assigns the appropriate bucket number to each row. The buckets are numbered from 1 to k.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, amount, 
 NTILE(2) over (partition by part 
 order by amount)
from orders;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: a function ROW_NUMBER does not need any explanations.
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select part, amount, 
 ROW_NUMBER() over (partition by part 
 order by amount)
from orders;
